bug.short_desc: docker-storage-setup: ERROR: Old mode of passing data and metadata logical volumes to docker is not supported. Exiting

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
On a fresh install of the f22 atomic image, (ec2 AMI: ami-89d1a0fe) followed by atomic host upgrade; reboot, docker-storage-setup fails to run.
The error is: ERROR: Old mode of passing data and metadata logical volumes to docker is not supported. Exiting
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
Atomic version: * 2015-09-01 22:50:33 22.102 132444ceed fedora-atomic fedora-atomic:fedora-atomic/f22/x86_64/docker-host
Docker version: docker-1.7.1-8.gitb6416b7.fc22.x86_64
How reproducible:
Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create new image from AMI ami-89d1a0fe 2. atomic host upgrade; reboot 3. docker-storage-setup
Actual results: ERROR: Old mode of passing data and metadata logical volumes to docker is not supported. Exiting
Expected results: Works

Fedora 22 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2016-07-19. Fedora 22 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug.
If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug.
Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.
Stephen could you confirm if this still happens or close this bug.
